descriptions: Student is unable to identify any personal stressors.
Student identifies one stressor but lacks detail or accuracy.
Student identifies a few stressors but demonstrates limited understanding of their impact.
Student identifies several personal stressors and demonstrates a basic understanding of their impact.
Student accurately identifies a range of personal stressors and explains their impact with some detail.
Student comprehensively identifies and articulates a deep understanding of a wide range of personal stressors and their nuanced impacts.
Student is unable to describe any coping mechanisms.
Student describes one ineffective or unhealthy coping mechanism.
Student describes a few coping mechanisms, but they are mostly ineffective or unhealthy.
Student describes some coping mechanisms, including at least one healthy strategy.
Student describes a variety of coping mechanisms, including several healthy and effective strategies, but lacks explanation of their proper application.
Student describes a wide range of healthy and effective coping mechanisms, explaining how and when to use them appropriately.
Student does not attempt to apply any coping strategies to a given scenario.
Student attempts to apply a coping strategy, but it is inappropriate or ineffective for the scenario.
Student attempts to apply coping strategies, but they are poorly executed or have limited effectiveness.
Student applies coping strategies with some success, but may require prompting or guidance.
Student effectively applies appropriate coping strategies to manage stress in a given scenario, demonstrating self-awareness.
Student skillfully and independently applies a diverse range of coping strategies to effectively manage stress in complex scenarios, demonstrating adaptability and resilience.
